videoSnippet.title: Bronstein Would be Proud  | MVL vs Anand | Grenke Chess Classic 2018.
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Check out the official trailer for Round 2 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cHKo71c6dFg

Interview with MVL https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VwQKULr0dY8

Interview with Anand https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TaY01wkboWI

Maxime Vachier-Lagrave vs Viswanathan Anand
GRENKE Chess Classic (2018), Karlsruhe GER, rd 2, Apr-01 
Sicilian Defense: Paulsen. Bastrikov Variation (B48)

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. d4 cd4 4. Nd4 Nc6 5. Nc3 Qc7 6. Be3 a6 7. Qf3 Nf6 8. O-O-O Ne5 9. Qg3 b5 10. a3 Bb7 11. Bb5 Rc8 12. Ba4 Ne4 13. Ne4 Be4 14. Bf4 Qc4 15. Be5 Qa4 16. Rd2 f6 17. Bd6 Kf7 18. Re1 Bg6 19. Bf8 Rhf8 20. Qd6 Kg8 21. f4 Rfe8 22. Re3 Qc4 23. b3 Qc7 24. Qc7 Rc7 25. Kb2 Rb8 26. g4 Bf7 27. a4 Rc5 28. Ne2 Rc7 29. Rd6 Ra7 30. Red3 Be8 31. f5 ef5 32. gf5 Rc8 33. Nc3 Rc5 34. R3d5 Rc6 35. Ne4 Kf7 36. Rd3 Rac7 37. c4 g6 38. fg6

The 2018 GRENKE Chess Classic is a 10-player round-robin held in Germany from 31 March to 9 April. The first 3 rounds are in Karlsruhe alongside the GRENKE Chess Open, then after a rest day the last 6 rounds are in the Kulturhaus LA8 in Baden-Baden. The field features World Champion Magnus Carlsen and fellow Top 10 players Fabiano Caruana, Maxime Vachier-Lagrave, Vishy Anand and Levon Aronian, as well as women's no. 1 Hou Yifan.

The time control is 100 minutes for 40 moves, then 50 minutes for 20 moves and then 15 minutes to the end of the game, with a 30-second increment from move 1. If players are tied for first place a rapid play-off will take place. Official website: www.grenkechessclassic.com
